title: Seventh-day Adventist Schools
description:
Seventh-day Adventist schools are Christian educational institutions operated by the Seventh-day Adventist Church. These schools emphasize holistic education addressing mental, physical, and spiritual development.

Key characteristics of Seventh-day Adventist schools:

• Whole-person education focusing on mind, body, and spirit
• Saturday (Sabbath) observance - schools closed Friday sunset to Saturday sunset
• Emphasis on health, including vegetarian food options
• Bible classes and religious education
• Strong science programs alongside faith instruction
• Global network of Adventist educational institutions
• Focus on service and community involvement

Adventist education is part of one of the largest Protestant educational systems in the world, with consistent curriculum and standards across schools.

These schools typically emphasize healthy lifestyle choices, including nutrition education and physical activity, as part of their holistic approach to student development.

When considering an Adventist school, ask about Sabbath observance policies, dietary guidelines, and how they accommodate students from non-Adventist families.
